meanings.sent1: The dog owner had to muzz the energetic puppy during training.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper decided to muzz the lion for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to muzz the bird feeder with acorns.
meanings.sent4: His fear of public speaking seemed to muzz his ability to express himself.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds seemed to muzz the sun's rays, casting a dark shadow over the field.

meanings.definition: The nose or mouth of an animal
meanings.sent1: The horse nuzzled the muzz of the foal affectionately.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian examined the muzz of the injured cat carefully.
meanings.sent3: The curious child tried to draw a smile on the muzz of the stuffed bear.
meanings.sent4: The muzz of the rabbit twitched nervously as it sniffed the fresh grass.
meanings.sent5: The muzz of the cow was wet from grazing in the morning dew.

meanings.definition: A covering for the nose and mouth, especially for protection against cold or dust.
meanings.sent1: The hiker wore a muzz to protect against the biting wind.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker put on a muzz before entering the dusty area.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's costume included a shiny muzz to conceal their identity.
meanings.sent4: She wrapped a cozy muzz around her face before stepping out into the snow.
meanings.sent5: The doctor advised wearing a muzz to prevent inhaling harmful particles.
